title: Why do I dislike a song when I first listen to it, but if I listen to it many times, I end up loving the song? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s a weird thing and I wish I had an explanation for it. You can hear a song, dislike it, click away, and after YouTube continually recommends it, you just start to like it. I guess it’s just because the song is an aquired taste of sorts, it’s a bit different - contrarily, when I find a song I like from an artist I like, it doesn’t usually take much time for me to like it since I already like it. All of this is not to be confused with those ‘Earworms’, those annoying songs that you don’lt like but they get stuck in your head. Nor is it about songs that you try and get yourself to like, and eventually you get yourself to believe that (don’t do that, by the way). This is a kind of interesting topic and does raise some questions about what makes us like certain music. On the one hand, there’s some music that we just like and some that we just don’t. On the other, you can like songs by association, the song you had your first kiss to for example, and sometimes it can take many relistens before you start to like a song. So for me, it’s not that easy to know if we like songs because of pure familiarity or other things.

Not my most favorite by a mile, but I find it hard to get out of my mind. Dani Calfornia by Chili Peppers. I’m not a RHCP fan at all and barely know about them. Can’t name another song they ever did. What little I’d heard, I didn’t much like. But I’d heard the snippet of the chorus “California, rest in peace” back 10 years ago or whatever, and it kind of stuck with me. Just recently, I was surfing YouTube and came on a kind of live-studio version of it and heard the whole thing. Now it’s quite annoyingly stuck in my head. I then went to listen to other RHCP songs, and as a band, I don’t like them. But this one song is just sticky with me. I wish it would go away. So, I dislike the band but really like that one song. Maybe that counts.  Another, somewhat in the same way, is How Soon is Now by The Smiths. Another apparently popular band I’d totally missed in the 80’s, but I’d heard snippets of that descending slide guitar glissando going down a half-step and reminding me of strange perceptions in days gone by I won’t talk about . . . . Well, early this year I heard the whole song and kind of played it all the time for a few months. I won’t say I didn’t like it at first, but for some reason I didn’t want to like it. It had to do with the guitar glissando.
